Record Class StringView

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
edu.westminsteru.jasm.parser.StringView
Record Components:
source - the source string that this StringView represents a slice of
start - the beginning index (inclusive) of this slice
end - the ending index (exclusive) of this slice
public record StringView(String source, int start, int end) extends Record
A class representing a “slice” of a String, preserving the index information. JasmParser uses this class extensively so that better diagnostics can be displayed to the user. This class is designed to replace many of the core features of a String, so many methods are inspired by String methods.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static StringView of(String source)
      Creates a StringView consisting of the entire content of a String.
      Parameters:
      source - the string content for this StringView
      Returns:
      a newly created StringView

    • firstWord

      public StringView firstWord(int ch)
      Returns a StringView consisting of the content of the string up to (but not including) the first occurrence of a given codepoint. (This method is the same as calling firstWord(int, Quoted) with StringView.Quoted.Ignore and ignores any occurrences of the delimiter inside quotes.)
      Parameters:
      ch - the codepoint of the delimiter
      Returns:
      a StringView up to the first occurrence of the delimiter, or the same view if the delimiter is not present

    • firstWord

      public StringView firstWord(int ch, StringView.Quoted q)
      Returns a StringView consisting of the content of the string up to (but not including) the first occurrence of a given codepoint. If q is StringView.Quoted.Ignore, any occurrences of the delimiter between double quotes " " are ignored.
      Parameters:
      ch - the codepoint of the delimiter
      q - the quote mode to follow
      Returns:
      a StringView up to the first occurrence of the delimiter, or the same view if the delimiter is not present

    • codePointAt

      public int codePointAt(int i)
      Returns the code point at a specified index.
      Parameters:
      i - the index
      Returns:
      the code point at index i}

      public int length()
      Returns the length of this StringView.
      Returns:
      the length

    • indexOf

      public int indexOf(int ch)
      Returns the first index of the given code point in this StringView, or -1 if it is not present.
      Parameters:
      ch - the code point to look for
      Returns:
      the index, or -1 if not found
      See Also:
      • String.indexOf(int)

    • indexOf

      public int indexOf(int ch, StringView.Quoted q)
      Returns the first index of the given code point in this StringView, or -1 if it is not present. If q is StringView.Quoted.Ignore, any occurrences of the code point between double quotes are ignored.
      Parameters:
      ch - the code point to look for
      q - the quote mode to follow
      Returns:
      the index, or -1 if not found
      See Also:
      • String.indexOf(int)

      end - the ending index (exclusive)
      Returns:
      the substring
      See Also:

      Returns:

    • tail

      public StringView tail(StringView head)
      Returns the remaining content of a StringView when a prefix is removed.
      Parameters:
      head - the prefix to remove
      Returns:
      the content of this StringView after head
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if head's backing String is different from this one's

    • split

      public List<StringView> split(int ch, StringView.Quoted q)
      Splits this StringView around the given delimiter (code point). If q is StringView.Quoted.Ignore, then any instances of the delimiter inside double quotes will not be split around.
      Parameters:
      ch - the delimiter (code point)
      q - the quote mode to follow
      Returns:
      the split StringViews

    • split

      public List<StringView> split(int ch)
      Splits this StringView around the given delimiter (code point). Any instances of the delimiter inside double quotes will not be split around.
      Parameters:
      ch - the delimiter (code point)
      Returns:
      the split StringViews

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
